results.description:
Sound Bath (both men and women welcome) in the comfort of a beautiful cozy home in Belmont. Come and soak in the sounds, vibrations, and healing energy during an intimate sound bath. Participation is limited so that you can each receive individual energetic healing through sound.

Two hour session consisting of powerful sounds, vibrations, energy and frequencies and meditation and reintegration. Journey in a safe and sacred space. Allow the sounds, frequencies, vibrations and energy move through you; melting away the stress and tension of the week. Help yourself rebalance, and relax. Sound healing, is extremely powerful and non-intrusive way to release emotional trauma and reduce physical pain. Instruments used will be Tibetan Singing Bowls, Bells, Tingshas, Hant Drum, Native American Drum, Rattles and the voice.

Energetic contribution of 30$.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket provided to ensure your comfort. Private sessions and instruction available by appointment.

Many blessings, Sarah - White Deer Song


A little about myself and my work through the voice of my clients:

Sarah Surrenders- White Deer Song- Is an Intuitive Healer who uses Sound as her main medium for healing. She is a Shamanic Practicioner, Legally Certified Spiritual Healer, Reiki Certified And Professionally Certified Sound Healer. Sarah leads retreats, workshops, Sound Healing classes, group sessions and offers private healings. Her focus is to help people come into their power, overcome challenges, releasing past emotional traumas, stress and anxiety reduction as well as soothing physical pain. Sarah has had beautiful responses to working on issues surrounding infertility, hormonal imbalance, anxiety, grief, depression and emotional traumas. Sarah travels extensively to pursue her studies, share the magic of sound as a healing tool and to recharge and continue her spiritual nomadic path in service and dedication. REVIEWS -

1.Sarah is absolutely amazing, she helped me deal with and move on from issues that had been dormant for many years. The outcome of my sessions was extremely positive and I am forever grateful that Sarah was able to guide me through my healing process with her beautiful sounds! If I could give a 10 star rating, I would. Thank you Sarah!!!! 2. Two years ago I met Sara through a mutual friend at a time I needed healing the most. During her group sessions, she taught us to meditate and calm our thoughts while she played her Himalayan bowls, tuning forks and many other shamanic healing techniques. With her guidance I found an inner calmness and some clarity. After a few sessions I decided I would go deeper into myself and asked for Sara to guide me in private sessions. What happened in these sessions has changed me and given me strength to believe and listen to my inner self all while healing some core issues I haven't dealt with, stemming from as far back as my childhood!
Sara you are an angel among angels.
I am grateful. Thank you 3. It's hard to find a true healer that is meant to help others and trust someone to heal you, but since the first practice with Sarah I felt so connected and truly amazed by results. So strong, devoted and passionate, ready to give whatever it takes to help. Thank you so much for wonderful experiences, visions, expansion and healing.. !

4. It's been over a year now and Sarah continues to help me and my family clear our paths and the results have been incredible - and now we are doing this long distance! What a blessing it has been to find this beautiful teacher and guide on our journey. When in the presence of someone whose work is their life's purpose, it can be felt and in Sarah's case, heard! Beautiful sounds creating beautiful results! Feeling lighter and more peaceful. Thank you so much. xo

5. Peace - love - calmness within you it's absolutely amazing; can't wait to see you Sarah at your next session!!

6. Wow. Get a sound healing from Sarah as soon as possible. It is really a life changing experience. We get so caught up in the world around us that we end up missing the world inside us. My experience with Sarah helped me get back in touch with my inner-world. What Sarah offers through her intuitive gifts, shamanic training, singing bowls and tuning forks is absolutely transformative. She is able to help you work through mental, emotional and physical blockages through the power of sound. I can't recommend Sarah more highly because she is the best at what she does. I've been practicing sound healing for years and Sarah is the most remarkable sound healer and teacher I've ever met. She does not just play the bowls. She invites them. Each time, depending on who she is healing, the bowls sound a different story and her intuitive power discovers what the story is and how it wants to play out. There are very few people that have this ability but what makes Sarah even more special is that she has the boundless compassion to heal with elegance and grace. I hope as many people support Sarah as possible as she is doing such an important service for all beings. She also does distant healings which are extremely effective. So, please, follow Sarah, receive a healing and be blessed in the source of beauty through which Sarah breathes, expands and heals.

results.description:
Are you Separated or Divorced, Considering Divorce, Or Currently in the Process of Divorce? Please join us for Divorce 101: A Legal Overview of the Divorce Process.

This is a multi-group event listed on other meetups, so attendance will be greater than the RSVP's on this meetup alone.


This event is intended to be partly informational, partly social, and totally empowering. Attendance to this event and information shared will be kept confidential.

For the first hour...Attorney Kimberly Keyes, accomplished divorce lawyer and presenter, will discuss the options for handling divorce and the key dates involved in the divorce process. (For more information on Attoney Keyes, including her bio, please click on this link: http://www.kimkeyeslaw.com/index.html)

The second hour will be a chance to socialize with other attendees and speak one-on-one with Attorney Keyes as well as the other professionals:

Jim Brennan of Maritime Mortgage

Joan Skomurski of Cameron Real Estate

Sheila May, CPA and Forensic Accountant

Robert Vona, Financial Representative

There is no cost for attendance. Complimentary refreshments and snacks will be provided.

Note that this Divorce 101 event will also be held at the same location on Thursday, January 28th, from 6:30 to 8:30 p.m. (meetup event listed separately).

Similar Divorce 101 events at this location will be held every month on the fourth Thursday and fourth Saturday. Please check the calendar for these upcoming events:

• Thursday, February 25 & Saturday, February 27, 2016; Divorce 101: The House...What are Your Options?

• Thursday, March 24 & Saturday, March 26, 2016; Divorce 101: Therapy...Managing Your Emotional Well-Being

results.description:
Let's meet up and socialize our puppies, and learn about puppy play behaviors. It is best to socialize your puppy when he is young to avoid a lot of unwanted behaviors as your puppy grows into a dog. This meet up is about socializing your dog to new situations, human touch, other puppies, grown dogs, and new objects. We will also talk about first aid, grooming your puppy, and other topics. We will answer questions and help you successfully house train your puppy. We will talk about dog training and demonstrate some things that trained dogs can do. The meet up can be loud and active with lots of barking, but it will be organized, so that you and your puppy can learn new things.

This MeetUp is for all puppies ages 8 weeks- 20 weeks. We ask that puppies have had at least their first round of vaccines. Cost of class is $10/puppy (cash please). Arrive a few minutes early to make sure we can start on-time. Please bring your puppy on a collar/harness and regular 4 or 6 foot leash (no flexi-leads please).

Email [masked] for more info. 

Want to learn more about the importance of early socialization? Read the AVSAB's position statement here: http://www.argostraining.com/wp-content/uploads/AVSAB-puppy_socialization.pdf

results.description:
We'll get together to celebrate upcoming Darwin Day 2016 (February 12) with this, our first GBH lecture of the new year, at the Humanist Hub in Cambridge (there will be NO free parking this time, sorry to say; see below for parking discount info.)

Our gathering will take place Saturday, January 30, from 12:30 - 3:30 pm at the Humanist Hub. We'll have some snacks and drinks available as we hear a special talk by our President, Joe Gerstein, on 'Was Darwin a Dunce?'

When Wolfgang Mozart was 7, it was clear where he was headed. Jascha Heifetz made his NYC  debut at a sold-out Carnegie Hall in knee pants at the age of 12. John Stuart Mill was fluent in Greek at 5. Most Nobel Science prize winners have done their most meritorious work before age 30. Galileo was an esteemed celebrity from his earliest days...a true Renaissance Man!


Charles Darwin trained to be a physician but didn't make the grade. He then got "gentleman's C's" at Cambridge and failed to proceed to his planned career in the clergy. His father, a successful physician, despaired his second son would ever amount to anything and told him so. Charles operated in the shadow of his grandfather, Erasmus Darwin,  a well-reputed intellectual. Who could have predicted the eventual outcome of this ineffectual performance? 

And then he sat on his revolutionary insights for 12 years and almost got scooped by a schoolteacher from New Zealand. 
What were the psychological and sociological and theological and medical issues which resulted in this bizarre procrastination of success in a man of genius? This man was sitting on top of a volcano that was about erupt into Victorian England. Perhaps he feared the controversy that would likely engulf him with the publication of his magnum opus. Actually, one of the major struts supporting his initial thesis was mistaken, but he had no way of knowing that the the time. 

Joe Gerstein will review some of the issues percolating in Darwin's life and times that might have influenced his behavior. Then let's all speculate about the importance and pertinence of each as we approach Darwin Day, one of organized humanism's most important tributes to science and humanity.

PARKING:

Discount Parking ONLY be available in the nearby Eliot St. Garage, only about a block away from the Hub. Bring your Eliot street parking ticket and it will be validated for a discount of $2 off.

Metered on-street parking is also available in Cambridge, and the Hub is just a short walk from Harvard Square T subway service.
results.name: GBH Darwin Day Celebration Talk: Was Darwin a Dunce?

Our past experience is that 20% of the RSVP shows up in the weekend meetings. Considering that, unless we have about 50 RSVPs, we cannot have a face to face meeting. This park has forest, river, a boardwalk through the marsh and a pond. The seven hundred acres known as Cutler Park comprise the largest remaining fresh water marsh on the middle Charles. Located in Needham and Dedham, the marsh and small lake attract over 100 species of birds which make Cutler Park a prime spot for nature study. Other activities suitable to this wetland preserve are hiking, canoeing and fishing. Open year-round, dawn to dusk.

DIRECTIONS Driving from Route 95: [color=red]directions: Take exit 19B to Highland Ave, take first left onto Hunting Rd, turn right on Kendrick St, look for Cutler Park reservation signs on your right. [/color]

http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/metroboston/cutlerPark.htm

results.description:
In celebration of it being a whole year since I (Caroline) joined the group, join me for a special anniversary swim! There will be a fun surprise workout and then unsurprising pizza :) This is part of the 10 week training program, but you can come to just this one if you want.

---------------


We're doing a fun 10-week training program! All levels are welcome, and you don't need to be able to make it every week. In week 1, we timed ourselves in a few key events (e.g. 100 freestyle), and now we're doing a training program to get ourselves faster. At the end of 10 weeks we'll time ourselves again and see how much we've improved! If you can't make a week, don't worry, you can still come to the other weeks.


The 10 weeks will include clinics on technique, flip turns, and any special requests, as well as some good sets to get us swimming faster. If there's a race you're targeting and want to work on that distance or event, let us know and we can help tailor the workouts for you.

We go across the street for pizza (or other food if you don't eat pizza) every week after the swim. Save time to join us! We usually finish up by about 4:30pm.


---------------


The pool opens at 2pm, so we meet to go in at 1:45 so that we can be out on the pool deck by 2. $6 to get in, Cambridge residents $5 (or you can buy a 10-pack for an approximate 10% discount, and we do these weekly so you'll have the opportunity to use them up).

Street parking is available but stressful, and the 69 bus drops off down the block, or you can bike or run there and do 2/3 of a triathlon :)
results.name: Saturday swimming - 10 week training program - Week 3 - Caroline's anniversary!

results.description:
Joe Boughan presents ....

The Social ToolKit: Impress The Boss, Win Over Friends, Gain Hot Dates, & Close Big Deals


Have you ever: 

Watched other people with less brains & experience get promoted before you at work?

Felt stuck under the glass ceiling at work?

Wanted to be able to effortlessly “work a room”?


Wondered how to land your dream date or career opportunity?


Wanted to feel more confident and relaxed in social situations?

This event will allow you to sharpen these skills and achieve total breakthroughs.

------------------------------------------------------------------

This seminar will provide content and exercises to help you expand the social skills you have to realize your power.

Famed scientist, Edward Thorndike, was the first to say that one’s social intelligence, that is, their ability to successfully interact with others, is the single biggest factor of success in life. It not only satisfies our basic need for social acceptance, it also has become the best way of attaining access to opportunities and resources in today’s increasingly networked society. In fact, since this statement was made, many there has been many discoveries and breakthroughs in the field. There is now plenty of evidence to support Thorndike's claim, as spot on, and has become more relevant  to anyone becoming a success in today’s super-connected world. Insights and tools in this seminar are necessary to be at the top of one's game in the social day-to-day and the end-goal game.

This seminar captures THOUSANDS of hours of research. Similar courses on the market are running for $200-$300. The content here is designed to help you sharpen your personality and social skills. By attending this class you will learn to become the type of person that fuels others and creates an environment of respect, positive exchange, of bolstered confidence, and of motivation. Attendees will return to their everyday life with a refined authentic self-image and the ability to apply the Social Toolkit in life to improve life conditions and relationships. No matter your role or level in life, this time can benefit you by sharpening the understanding of the interactions that determine your success. With these tools anyone can take their life to a new level of high performance.

------------------------------------------------------------------

Takeaways: 

Discover how to walk into any room with the charisma and skills to attract the right people.

Master the keys to create powerful conversations to win the favor of mentors or valued alliances

Gain the ability to create instant rapport and strengthen peer alliances so that you know you'll have rich and flourishing network.

Skyrocket your influence, impress your boss and peers by asserting yourself and resolving conflict in a snap

Accomplish all of this from a place of authenticity, leaving behind a trail of positivity, without compromising your true self

------------------------------------------------------------------

All participants will get free booklet of the class content for mastery of these concepts. There will be refreshments and snacks provided for all attendees. 

Please note that 10% of evert ticket is donated directly to the Carolina-YES Network which provides inner-city youth with entrepreneurship skills and education necessary to break the cycles of many impoverished generations to build an economically productive business and life. 

There are only about 30-40 available seats in this meeting room, so buy tickets early! 

------------------------------------------------------------------

Presenters:  


Joe Boughan is the creative director for Fluency Toolkit. He bootstrapped from a rebellious youth to be an inspirational speaker on psychology, communication skills, and high performance. He has applied the skills described in the Fluency Toolkit seminar to be the #1 global new sales development leader in the talent development software space. 

------------------------------------------------------------------ 

PLEASE PURCHASE TICKETS HERE

results.description:
It was more than a year ago I had the pleasure of sitting around and chatting with 3 other women who were on the trip to Iceland. We slowed down and conversation just flowed beautifully. I've thought of that afternoon ever since and I have finally found a place to host similar gatherings.

Let's meet at this new cafe that serves a full breakfast and lunch.  From its FB page:  "We work directly with our farmers in Rwanda, pay higher than Fair Trade prices, and invest in sustainable village projects. DRINK COFFEE. DO GOOD".   Further,  it is a social enterprise by a Lynn Ministry to provide work experience to folks so they can be better able to find regular employment. 


There is usually street parking right on Monroe St.   PLEASE NOTE,  the map that Meetup links to is now correct.


If it snows that day and driving is difficult,  I'll cancel the event. I shouldn't have to say this,  but same day cancellations will be treated as a no-show.  Please be considerate of other members,  especially if there is a wait list.

Sound Bath in the comfort of a cozy home in Belmont. Come and soak in the sounds, vibrations, and healing energy during an intimate sound bath. Participation is limited so that you can each receive individual energetic healing through sound. Hour and a forty five minute session consisting of powerful sounds, vibrations, energy and frequencies and meditation and reintegration. Journey in a safe and sacred space. Allow the sounds, frequencies, vibrations and energy move through you; melting away the stress and tension of the week. Help yourself rebalance, and relax. Sound healing, is extremely powerful and non-intrusive way to release emotional trauma and reduce physical pain. Instruments used will be Tibetan Singing Bowls, Bells, Tingshas, Native American Drum, Rattles and the voice.

Energetic contribution of 30$ cash.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket provided to ensure your comfort. Private sessions and instruction available by appointment.

Please note a minimum of 6 confirmed guests is required to host the event due to the effort and energy required before, during and after! Thanks for your understanding! 

Many blessings, 

Sarah - White Deer Song


A little about myself and my work through the voice of my clients:

Sarah Surrenders- White Deer Song- Is an Intuitive Healer who uses Sound as her main medium for healing. She is a Shamanic Practicioner, Legally Certified Spiritual Healer, Reiki Certified And Professionally Certified Sound Healer. Sarah leads retreats, workshops, Sound Healing classes, group sessions and offers private healings. Her focus is to help people come into their power, overcome challenges, releasing past emotional traumas, stress and anxiety reduction as well as soothing physical pain. Sarah has had beautiful responses to working on issues surrounding infertility, hormonal imbalance, anxiety, grief, depression and emotional traumas. Sarah travels extensively to pursue her studies, share the magic of sound as a healing tool and to recharge and continue her spiritual nomadic path in service and dedication. REVIEWS -

1.Sarah is absolutely amazing, she helped me deal with and move on from issues that had been dormant for many years. The outcome of my sessions was extremely positive and I am forever grateful that Sarah was able to guide me through my healing process with her beautiful sounds! If I could give a 10 star rating, I would. Thank you Sarah!!!! 2. Two years ago I met Sara through a mutual friend at a time I needed healing the most. During her group sessions, she taught us to meditate and calm our thoughts while she played her Himalayan bowls, tuning forks and many other shamanic healing techniques. With her guidance I found an inner calmness and some clarity. After a few sessions I decided I would go deeper into myself and asked for Sara to guide me in private sessions. What happened in these sessions has changed me and given me strength to believe and listen to my inner self all while healing some core issues I haven't dealt with, stemming from as far back as my childhood!
Sara you are an angel among angels.
I am grateful. Thank you 3. It's hard to find a true healer that is meant to help others and trust someone to heal you, but since the first practice with Sarah I felt so connected and truly amazed by results. So strong, devoted and passionate, ready to give whatever it takes to help. Thank you so much for wonderful experiences, visions, expansion and healing.. !

4. It's been over a year now and Sarah continues to help me and my family clear our paths and the results have been incredible - and now we are doing this long distance! What a blessing it has been to find this beautiful teacher and guide on our journey. When in the presence of someone whose work is their life's purpose, it can be felt and in Sarah's case, heard! Beautiful sounds creating beautiful results! Feeling lighter and more peaceful. Thank you so much. xo

5. Peace - love - calmness within you it's absolutely amazing; can't wait to see you Sarah at your next session!!

6. Wow. Get a sound healing from Sarah as soon as possible. It is really a life changing experience. We get so caught up in the world around us that we end up missing the world inside us. My experience with Sarah helped me get back in touch with my inner-world. What Sarah offers through her intuitive gifts, shamanic training, singing bowls and tuning forks is absolutely transformative. She is able to help you work through mental, emotional and physical blockages through the power of sound. I can't recommend Sarah more highly because she is the best at what she does. I've been practicing sound healing for years and Sarah is the most remarkable sound healer and teacher I've ever met. She does not just play the bowls. She invites them. Each time, depending on who she is healing, the bowls sound a different story and her intuitive power discovers what the story is and how it wants to play out. There are very few people that have this ability but what makes Sarah even more special is that she has the boundless compassion to heal with elegance and grace. I hope as many people support Sarah as possible as she is doing such an important service for all beings. She also does distant healings which are extremely effective. So, please, follow Sarah, receive a healing and be blessed in the source of beauty through which Sarah breathes, expands and heals.

There is nothing more wonderful than a nice stroll through Boston on a summer day, that is, unless you add food and wine! 

This fabulous 

2 hour guided walking tour

 stops at fine Boston restaurants and wine stores to teach you how to buy wines, find hidden gems and 

educate you in the fine art of wine tasting and food pairing

. While enjoying your food and wine, you will even learn a bit of Boston history.

This 

Wine & Food Walking Tour 

generally includes:


Tastings of 6 delicious wines, paired up with food.Learning how to taste wine. 

2-3 tour stops

 including a variety of restaurants.A chance to explore Boston's vibrant culture


with a local guide.

Our first stop

 on the tour is Pasta Beach, a classic Italian restaurant, which offers a great wine list and delicious food. This restaurant sits on the cusp of Boston Harbor. 

Our second stop

 is Tamo Bistro & Bar. You will embark on a scenic walk, which takes us up Sea Port Lane to a beautiful hotel. Here we will sample delicious wine and food pairings while enjoying views of the harbor.

Our third stop

 is either Salvatore's, or J Pace Wine Shop. This stop takes us further up the sea port where we learn how to pair wine with Italian dishes.

Learn how to taste, pour and pair wine, join us today for a memorable tour!

results.description:
The Kendall has posted the movie time and the opportunity to purchase advance tickets.  We will be going to the 4:30pm showing and then to the Cambridge Brewing Co afterwards to discuss.  CBC doesn't take reservations after 6pm, so we may have to wait a bit.  I'll see what I can work out! I'll post a link to the trailer in the comments as well.

Don't miss this rare opportunity to see all five Academy Award nominees in the category of Best Live Action Short! Program includes: “Ave Maria” (Palestine/France/Germany), in which the silent routine of five Palestinian nuns living in the West Bank wilderness is disturbed when an Israeli settler family breaks down right outside the convent just as the Sabbath comes into effect; “Day One” (USA), depicting a new translator’s first day accompanying a U.S. Army unit as it searches for a local terrorist; “Everything Will Be Okay (Alles Wird Gut)” (Germany/Austria), about a divorced father who picks up his eight-year-old daughter Lea, as he does every second weekend, but she can‘t help feeling that something isn't right; “Shok” (Friend) (Kosovo/UK), in which the friendship of two boys is tested to its limit as they battle for survival during the Kosovo war; and “Stutterer” (UK/Ireland), the story of Greenwood, whose online girlfriend Ellie travels to London on the eve of their six-month anniversary to surprise him.

We will be voting for own best short!

results.description:
I had the delicious pleasure of dining on Suya Joint's Grand Re-Opening Day which was such a wonderful experience  I had to schedule another outing.

Suya Joint Restaurant is an elegant West African bar and lounge designed to appeal to local Africans searching for a taste of home and to Americans exploring the food and culture of exotic Africa.

Check out the menu before you arrive so we can order shortly after we're seated. Here is the link with the menu, http://suyajoint.com/

Suya Joint is owned and operated by Nigerian chef Cecelia Lizotte.

"Suya" is a favored Nigerian food delicacy. Suya kabobs are made of thinly sliced beef or chicken seasoned with authentic Nigerian herbs and spices. Suya Joint offers the finest suya available along with a full array of traditional Nigerian cuisine.

The food at Suya Joint is prepared fresh from scratch using natural ingredients to create dishes which are flavorful and spiced according to each diners preference from mild to extremely spicy.

Public Transportation:

MBTA Orange line to Ruggles and buses 15, 23, 28, and 45 connect you to Dudley Station

Walk up Dudley Street towards the fire station

Suya Joint will be on your right

Busses 15 and 45 stop outside Suya Joint

Driving:

Check out Google to arrange driving directions.

Parking:

There is a parking lot behind Hibernian Hall on Zeigler Street as well as municipal lots on Harrison Ave (entrance near 1116)  and Warren Street (enter from Zeigler Street). You can also find parking along Dudley Street and the side streets ... suggest you read parking signs to avoid being ticketed and/or towed.

RESERVATION RULES:

Before I list the Reservation Rules, please understand the NO-SHOW policy was established to ensure everyone who wants to join can and it will be fairly and strictly enforced.

I want to assure you I do understand if you RSVP YES and you have a sudden change of plans but not a better offer. My only request is, you MUST let me know as soon as possible so we don't worry about you and our reservation is adjusted. As long as you contact me at (857)[masked], you will not be considered a NO-SHOW.

Rules for Events with Reservations:

If it is less than an hour from the meal and you are not able to attend or are running late, you MUST call or text me at (857) 266-7657.

Please be considerate of your fellow diners time by arriving PROMPTLY.

Please bring enough cash to pay for your meal, drinks, tip, and tax.

All RSVPs are on a first reply, first reserved basis.

You may only RSVP YES or NO and WAIT LIST if the meal is full.

Maybe is NOT an option.

If you RSVP YES or WAIT LIST, you MUST answer the question which appears after your RSVP. If you don't your RSVP will be changed to NO.

If the meal is full and you wish to attend, please select WAIT LIST RSVP and call/text (857) 266-7657.

Please RSVP YES only if you are CERTAIN you will attend.

If you're not sure you can attend because you have other unconfirmed plans or uncertain transportation, please RSVP NO with a comment.

If your name appears on the event page as a YES after the meal and you have not attended nor contacted me, it is counted as a NO-SHOW.

If I change your RSVP to NO because you haven't replied to a final update confirmation email deadline, it is counted as a NO-SHOW.

If any guests you've RSVPd for NO-SHOW, each will count as if you've NO-SHOWED.

If you CHANGE your RSVP from a YES to a NO WITHIN AN HOUR of the dinner, it is counted as a NO-SHOW if you do not contact me at (857) 266-7657.

NO-SHOWS impact everyone; from you, who could or has been on the wait list to the organizer as well as the restaurant's who staff based on our reservation.

An email from you explaining your sudden absence is an expected courtesy.

Your feedback is appreciated, so please, rate the event and venue by completing the survey afterward.

I will arrive at 5:00 PM to welcome you at the bar.

results.description:
With the new year, BostonWine kicks off its educational series. Expect more of these "track" themed events as we find new ways to tantalize, inform and have fun exploring all the diverse elements of wine and its interaction with food, making new friends and general mirth making.

Please join me and our member Jim Smith, wine TV host extraordinaire (true!) to explore what gives wine Body! 

Body is the sense of weight or viscosity that a wine leaves in your mouth.  Wines with higher alcohol content tend to have more body than wines with lower alcohol content.  Sugar, oak, and tannin can also add body.  We will drink a progression of several wines from light body to heavy body and and have some fun comparing them! 


If you want to practice at home before joining us you can do a similar experiment with milk.  The fat in milk acts a lot like the alcohol in wine - it adds body.  Try drinking some 1% milk, then whole milk, then heavy cream.  Notice how the 1% milk is a little watery and the heavy cream fills the mouth?  That's body!

COST 

$25 for wine due with RSVP 

Usual BostonWine refund policy applies. I will refund 100% up to 1 day in advance of the event. After that time, no refund. We are now using Meetup's payment service WePay. Let Jim F. know if there are any issues.

==> READ THIS! The event starts promptly at 5:00 PM, so please be on time. We can't guarantee that there will be wine available if you are late. 

FYI: greeters will be on hand from 5:00 - 6:00 PM. Security is tight and access shuts down at 6:00 PM. You won't be able to get in if late!  <==

POLICIES

Limited to 30 total including +1s; final spots reserved for newbies. Everyone must be a member of BostonWine. RSVP early, but please don't RSVP unless you're sure that you can make it.

NOTE: As part of the RSVP process you will be asked to accept the group's Policies and Disclaimer (use a new web browser window to see the About Us section of our group's home page). You must answer "Yes" in this event's RSVP to attend. (Note, apparently some versions of the Meetup mobile app don't display this question -- in that case, RSVP with your phone and then use a web browser later on to update your RSVP). 

WHAT TO BRING 

Of course there will be food, but this event leans more towards the informative. I'll put together a cheese platter for the event and get some plates. I have wine glasses. Of course, you can bring other nibbles if you'd like.

WINE

We'll be mixing them up, breaking the rules, but focusing on body for this one:

• ? Pinot Grigio, Italy (light body white, ~$12)


• Block Nine Pinot Noir, Caiden's Vineyards, California, USA ($13)

•  Chateau Saint Michelle, Indian Wells Chardonnay, Columbia Valley, Washington, USA ($19)

• Torrontes, Argentinian red, Argentina ($13)


• Federalist Zinfandel, California, USA (~$23)


We may add more wines to the flight depending on size of event.

WHERE

The event will be held in the Club Room of the Hanover CambridgePark apartment building near the Alewife T station. 

We have access to a demonstration kitchen, fridge, ice machine, etc. 

Hanover CambridgePark 
160 CambridgePark Drive 
Club Room, 1st floor 
Cambridge, MA 02140 

Phone:[masked]

T stop: Alewife (Red line)

Parking: Unfortunately, there is no guest parking at Hanover. Public transportation or a car service such as Uber is preferable. Otherwise, park at Alewife T station ($7). Park and walk to main lobby of 160 and follow general directions. 

ABOUT

The Hanover CambridgePark is a luxury apartment building complex in the Alewife area of Cambridge. It has a spacious club room where we'll be meeting, a spa-like pool, fitness center, pool, courtyard with fire pits, grills, high-end finishes, etc. 

For those interested in seeing a model apartment, leasing staff will be on hand before the event to do a tour (call ahead to be sure to get a spot). Remember to let them know that you're part of BostonWine. ;-) 

The Jims look forward to seeing you!

-Jim & Jim

results.description:
How did people keep warm in 19th century America? Experience the Old Manse on a winter's evening and imagine how cold and dark it was. Encounter "new" heating technologies, like the Rumford fireplace, used by Manse residents. View a 19th century heating stove like the one Nathaniel Hawthorne installed, on display today only. The evening ends with light 19th century refreshments as we share Hawthorne's thought-provoking, often humorous, and still relevant views from a sketch entitled "Fire Worship," which he wrote while living at the Manse in the 1840s.


$10
results.name: Fire Worship: Keeping Warm in 19th Century America

Private estate event location disclosed to ticket holders prior to event, ticket holders subject to venue rules. Positive identification required for entry. Event entry to all 18+ (21+ required for alcoholic beverages); medicated tastings for MMJ patients only.   Tickets are $11.54 for Cannabis Society members on eventbrite.   


The event will be taking place in Milton, Massachusetts.


RSVP:  https://www.eventbrite.com/e/activate-gourmet-cannabis-events-tickets-20972806228

Join Cannabis Society as we attend Ardent Cannabis's new event series ACTIVATE at a fabulous venue for a one-of-a-kind glimpse into the world of gourmet cannabis edibles. Across the nation, chefs, caregivers, patients, and connoisseurs are re-imagining this wonderful herb to create delicious and uplifting creations. Now, advances in technology and science make it possible for any patient to become an expert and take these recipes and philosophies into their own home. 


On January 30, Ardent will unveil the ACTIVATE series, an opportunity to see, taste and experience the best of what the industry had to offer. Set at a gorgeous estate just south of the city, we will be featuring an exclusive demonstration and tasting featuring the bicoastal flavors of:

Boomshaka Cupcakes - Boomshaka is LA's premier medicated cupcake, the favorite flavor for locals and celebrities alike, Boomshaka blends high-end gourmet ingredients and flavors with an expressive and culture-centered brand   www.boomshakacupcakes.com

District Growers MORE... Until now, patients in our nation's capital have been the only ones to experience the super refreshing gourmet cold pressed medicated juices created by the talented hands at District Growers, one of only five dispensaries in Washington D.C.  MORE... juices enhance every mood or experiences, and whether its More passion, More energy, or More freedom you desire, District Growers has it covered. 

Nova Decarboxylator: Now that the science of decarboxylation (activating herb for edibles) has been perfected in a simple counter-top device, anyone can become an expert.  We'll demonstrate how different types of herb can be activated, and use the best methods from the leading dispensaries and edibles makers to create their most popular treats. 


Private estate event location disclosed to ticket holders prior to event, ticket holders subject to venue rules. Positive identification required for entry. Event entry to all 18+ (21+ required for alcoholic beverages); medicated tastings for MMJ patients only. 



Legal Disclaimer  

Views or opinions expressed by speakers or sponsors at our local Cannabis Society community events do not necessarily express the opinion or views of the Cannabis Society organization and we do not take responsibility for the views expressed or the actions of speakers or sponsors at our local events. The Cannabis Society does not distribute cannabis.

The Cannabis Society is Growing  

Our group has grown by leaps and bounds these past few years and we are proud to announce that the Cannabis Society is going to continue to grow and develop our ecosystem with groundbreaking events centering around medical cannabis, technology, art, and science. We couldn’t do it without our members and we want to thank you for being apart of this growing organization.

results.description:
We will practice together, play and study theory.

Usually we get quite a few beginners, so if you are just starting don't be shy, you definitely can join us. If you have been playing for some time I am sure you will find a few helpful ideas as well. If the level will be very different then we might divide it to two groups eventually.

Half of the class time is dedicated to a consecutive curriculum. We try to choose themes that are relevant to everybody in the class. We might talk about some aspects of technique, or reading, or theory etc. The other half of the class time we usually help students with their individual issues and questions.

We see this class as a supportive and motivational environment for your self-teaching process. There are two experienced guitar teachers (Anastasiya Dumma and David Lee), both Berklee grads, who are ready to answer all your questions and suggest new things to practice!

This is PAY-WHAT-YOU-WANT class. We kindly ask you to support your teachers and Westland Guitars that provided the space. Online donations feel a bit inconvenient (sorry), so you can contribute when you come to the class.

Described as the very best and very worst of humanity's humor from the greatest card game on Earth.  Come out and meet singles while trading laughs and testing your sarcasm by playing "Cards Against Humanity."  If you're not easily offended and enjoy a good laugh - this is the perfect icebreaker!  It's the best way to get rid of the butterflies and turn your night into social high gear.

For more information on the game, please visit www.cardsagainsthumanity.com.

You're bound to make a new friend, connection, or possible future date by just showing up.  Also, don't forget to ask about our matchmaking services where you can meet more professional Boston singles outside of this event. 80% of first timers report that they are nervous only leading up to the event, so do not worry if this is your first time. Scenergy believes in an open environment where our hosts ensure you feel welcome, safe, and are having fun - we hope to see you there!

7:00 p.m. - 7:30 p.m. - Participants Arrive & Register (If at the door, tickets are available).

7:30 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. - "Cards Against Humanity" begins.

9:00 p.m. - TBD - Raffle Prizes and closing remarks.

Price:

- All tickets include your first drink

- $25 at the door (if tickets available)

- $17 pre-paid RSVP *(Limited to 25 male/ 25 female tickets)

Early bird special: 

First 10 to use promocode "earlybird" save $5 off the prepaid price (pay $12 instead of $17).

Pre-pay by CLICKING HERE

* Once all 25 male/ 25 female tickets have been sold, we will release more tickets in increments. We are able to hold a maximum of 60 singles (30 males / 30 females)!

Recommended Attire:

Men - Come presentable; highly recommend collared shirt with jeans or slacks.

Women - Come casual but classy; do not have to come in a dress but blouses recommended over shirts.

results.description:
When was the last time you danced?   Join your fellow trolls to dance shamelessly to disco on Jan 30.  

The disco-fueled interactive dance party known as The Donkey Show, very loosely inspired by Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream, puts you smack in the middle of the action in a funky Cambridge lounge setting. Featuring two full bars and a dance floor, OBERON's Diane Paulus-created wonderland was inspired by Studio 54 in its heyday, when celebrities and art icons would mix and mingle with kids from Queens, and the Saturday Night Fever soundtrack would be shaking the speakers. While you -- and the rest of the audience -- drink, dance to disco classics or just check out the action, the motley crew of characters in this glammed-up, sex-fueled version of Shakespeare's play re-enact the hilariously chaotic tale of a magic elixir that wreaks havoc at the nightclub. But it's mostly just a cool boogie-filled bash.

You can pickup your tickets at ART or goldstar.com.  I think goldstar is $10 cheaper than the ART website.

http://americanrepertorytheater.org/events/show/donkey-show


https://www.goldstar.com/events/cambridge-ma/the-donkey-show

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=URRGqM4prHE

Photo from my last Donkey Show. Enjoy!
results.how_to_find_us: We will be lining up outside at 7PM for the 7:30 show. Txt at 781 325 8776

results.description:
From Asti to Barolo, the wines of Piedmont are among Italy’s most prolific and best rated. Piedmont is one of the two most famous regions of wine in Italy (the other is Tuscany).  The region’s pedigree is apparent in its 58 DOC and DOCG zones, and although it is only the sixth largest producer in terms of volume, it has the highest percentage of classified wines in all of Italy. 


Please bring your favorite Piedmont wine in a paper wine bag, 4 glasses, and $15 to contribute toward food which will be provided.
results.name: Explore the wines of Piedmont

WEEAC Netflix/Twitter screening of COWSPIRACY The Sustainability Secret. Saturday January 30, 2016 at 7pm watch Cowspiracy on Netflix, login to Twitter, and join the conversation. Follow at  #WeeacFilm.  (Join netflix.com 1st month free, cancel anytime.)  facebook.com/events/[masked].

COWSPIRACY: The Sustainability Secret is a groundbreaking feature-length environmental documentary following an intrepid filmmaker as he uncovers the most destructive industry facing the planet today – and investigates why the world's leading environmental organizations are too afraid to talk about it. As eye-opening as Blackfish and as inspiring as An Inconvenient Truth, this shocking yet humorous documentary reveals the absolutely devastating environmental impact large-scale factory farming has on our planet.  cowspiracy.com
results.name: WEEAC Netflix/Twitter COWSPIRACY The Sustainability Secret

results.description:
Let’s talk wine… Chardonnay may be one of the most popular white wines, but there are a lot of other great white varietals that aren’t in the spotlight quite as often. You usually find them lumped as “Other White Wines” on the wine menu.  Join us in exploring those “other white wines” and expand your white wine knowledge! Ranging from crisp and lively to smooth and supple, we will have a blast exploring and comparing these whites, and maybe even find a new favorite! 

Bring a bottle of ABC from the “other white wines” and an appetizer to share. I will have some sweets to round things out. 


Rich and I will host the evening at our home (Winthrop) and will forward the address to those attending a few days in advance. 

We look forward to enjoying a glass of wine with you!
results.name: ABC Wines  (Anything But Chardonnay)

Cohost Angela has all the details arranged. We'll even have name tags so we don't have to remember names.

Here's the entire detailed event description from Social Fun.

results.description:
Join single members of Social Fun (SF) and South Shore Hike Bike & Social Club (SSHBSC) for a Saturday evening of socializing with other singles while playing billiards/pool as we start the new year!  We already bowl here and have played pool a couple of times so let's do this for singles!  O'Lindy's is fun yet laidback and is a great place to bowl, play pool, and socialize with friends.  Join us for a couple of hours on Saturday night as we socialize and play pool with other singles.

We have reserved a "private "room"" which provides us up to 4 pool tables plus most of the seated tables and the opportunity to bring in our own snacks.  We need at least 24 Total Yes RSVPs by Weds 1/27 in order to maintain this reservation.  If we have less than that we will revert back to renting pool tables only and purchasing snacks from O'Lindy's.

O'Lindy's sells snacks and beverages, including alcohol. We are requesting $10pp for tonight's event to cover the cost of the pool table rentals and snacks.  While the event begins @ 7:30pm you can join us anytime, however, we highly recommend arriving by 8pm so everyone can enjoy themselves and socialize.  If we have at least 30 people in attendance (i.e. 35 Yes RSVPs w/ minimal No-Shows) then we can lower the cost to $8pp.  There are no discounts for late arrivals. Any leftover money will be reimbursed to members for a dollar apiece and/or sent to Biagio to help cover the cost of the group.  (Please see "Cost/Fees" section below for more info.)

If anyone would like to volunteer to bring a snack you will be provided a discounted admission of $5.  Please indicate in the sections in the Conversations below what you are planning to bring no later than Jan 26th.  This option will be limited to 4 total members between the groups.

"Single" is defined as not in a relationship or dating one person on a "regular" basis.  You are available to date others if you so choose and are otherwise unattached or held back.  This is a great opportunity for us to meet singles within the participating meetup groups listed below.  (If you are interested in having your group participate please contact Angela no later than Saturday, January 23rd.  She must be a member of your group in order for your group to be considered.  A limited number of groups will be able to join SF and SSHBSC and you need to be able to bring 3-6 people.)

Social Fun (SF): www.meetup.com/socialfun

South Shore Hike Bike & Social Club (SSHBSC): www.meetup.com/socialnetwork-1414

The Eligibiles!: http://www.meetup.com/Adventurous-singles-35-55/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 


South Shore SINGLES Billiards/Pool Social!!

Saturday, January 30th @ 7:30-9:30pm

O'Lindy's

170 Quincy Avenue (Route 53 SB)

Quincy, MA 02169

Phone #[masked]

Website: http://olindysbowling.com/

Meeting Location:  Please meet near the front desk.  If you arrive after we head to our pool tables look for a meetup sign.  The reservation is under "Angela" and "Meetup."

Host(s)/Organizer(s): Angela & TBD ~ Ann is Co-Host for SF, Suzanne is Co-Host for Eligibles & Boston Walking, Seeking Co-Host for SSHBSC (Reservation is under Meetup and Angela.)

Min/Max: Minimum of 12 people 48 hours prior to the event;we need 25 by 1/27 to keep the private party area.  Maximum of 45 total attendees which can be increased as follows: SF = 15, SSHBSC = 10, Eligibles = 10, Boston Walking = 10.

Guests: TBD, if so, it would be 1 per member 
Cash Only Policy: Please bring cash! Paying for our meals in cash allows us to avoid the confusion of having the waitstaff run multiple credit card slips and generally helps to keep things simpler for everyone. 
Cost/Fees: Each pool table is $12/hr w/ a $10 deposit.  We will be collecting $6pp to cover the cost of pool, appetizers/snacks that we will order, and a bunch of songs on the jukebox.  With the party room we will be collecting **$10pp,** $8pp if we have at least 30 people in attendance (35 Yes RSVPs).  (Please note, we rarely collect event fees but we do need to pay for pool and some snacks may add to the fun of the evening.)  If you are a member of SF and want to make your annual $10 voluntary contribution to Social Fun I will be happy to collect and mail it to Biagio and it will cover your cost for tonight's event.  Biagio requests a $10 donation after attending your 3rd event.  (If half the people who attended 3+ events actually made the donation it would be a one-time request.  Alas, not so.)

RSVP Deadline: Saturday, January 30th @ 3pm ~ Any changes made after this time will be considered a No-Show so please finalize your RSVP by this time.

Inclement Weather Reschedule Date: TBD

No-Show Policy:  People who RSVP "Yes" to events are expected to exercise common sense and common courtesy. That means making your best effort to keep any commitments that you make, but if necessary doing your best to notify the Event Organizer or (preferably, if it's the day of the event) the venue if something comes up after the RSVP deadline. If you find yourself unable to attend an event that you've RSVPed "Yes" to and you cannot either change your RSVP or let the venue know, please do contact the Event Organizer when you're able to, just to let us know that you're okay and that you're still interested in attending events.  Please be advised that any Assistant Organizer (AO) or the Group Organizer (GO) can remove a member from Social Fun who has 3 No-Shows in the past 3 months.  Additionally, Organizers may disallow members with 2 or more "No Show" marks from attending their events.  **Please keep in mind that we are reserving pool tables based on the number of people who RSVP Yes to attend and if we show-up missing more than 10% of the people it has an adverse affect on everyone else attending as well as the venue as we are planning based on RSVPs and if there's a Waitlist (WL) then you are taking away a spot for someone else if you do not change your RSVP when you are no longer able to attend.**

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Parking: Free parking on-site and in their extended lot across the street.  If lots are full drive north on Route 53 to the next set of lights where you will take a right (onto Scammell Street) and then you can take a left into the big free parking lot where Quincy Credit Union and a gym are located.  (Please do not park in the strip mall or Citizens Bank parking lots.)

Directions/Location Overview:  This is located on Route 53 NB in Quincy about 2 miles from the Braintree line and less than 1/2 mile from Kam Man Plaza (where Bradlees used to be over 2 decades ago).  This is also on the bus line which you can catch from the Quincy Center T station.  For exact directions, please go to their website or google map it.


Please Note: If you are a member of Social Fun or any other group participating, please RSVP Yes w/ one group and No w/ the other group(s).  I can give you credit for attending for all groups but only if you RSVP in some way w/ SF as it's very challenging to find people in that group to add them in when editing attendance.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the Front Desk and then at our Pool tables thereafter. Reservation is under "Angela" and "Meetup."
results.name: Saturday Night South Shore Billiards/Pool Social!!

group.name: South Shore Hike, Bike & Social Club

results.description:
Let's Play Dodgeball!

Remember when you used to get a lunch break AND recess? Let'slationships were formed while we were playing games-we made friends, scores were settled, and we figured out how to interact with the opposite sex. Well, some of us did :)

https://youtu.be/QPDs4zs3kzw

Remember when you used to get a lunch break AND recess? Let's return to our glory days for some school yard fun! So many relationships were formed while we were playing games-we made friends, scores were settled, and we figured out how to interact with the opposite sex. Well, some of us did :)

Worried about being branded with the logo from the rubber ball? Well, don't...we use soft squishy balls…without a visible logo :) So, if you really hope to get a tattoo, you'll have to find another way.

Dodgeball Details: Teams are chosen round robin style, so it doesn't matter if you ruled the schoolyard at one point. There won't be any awkward "I hope I'm chosen before the kid in the full body cast". The "rules" will be explained by the referee before playing starts. They aren't complex, and there won't be any instant replays for controversial calls.

It's designed to be fun, playful, and casual. The only rule I can remember is not aiming for someone's head. Ladies, I can't guarantee that the guys are going to follow that one : ) Guys, this is still not the best way to get a woman's attention….

All levels are welcome! We will be playing on a padded floor, wearing socks (remember to bring socks!). The arena is air conditioned and is smaller than a typical dodgeball court. There are two individual bathrooms that some people change in. Some people come prepared to play, while others change.

Dodgeball of Boston is located at 1 Broadway in Arlington, MA. There is a small parking lot, emphasis on small, and free street parking available on the side streets. Public transportation is probably the easiest way to get there. It's about one mile from Davis Sq Redline T and Alewife T Stations.

Cost: $10. PLEASE try to pay with a $10 bill, or some combination that adds up to $10 ($5 bills, $1 bills, etc…), as change is hard to make. The cover goes to pay the rent for the space.

After Dodgeball: We will head for drinks/appetizers/Karaoke nearby at:

Orleans Restaurant 
65 Holland Street 
Davis Square, Cambridge

We always have a lot of fun there too, drinking, eating and singing karaoke, and it's a great way to enjoy Friday night!

This will be a joint event with other meet up groups, please only RSVP in one group.

IMPORTANT: Please be sure to bring socks with you in order to play!

--Carla & Matt 
;-)

https://youtu.be/cXmt_iFLd58
results.name: Dodge The Ball! - Play Dodgeball With Us!

results.description:
Come join us at this great coffeehouse for a wonderful night of folk music! The No Fuss and Feathers Roadshow is the “heck-of-a-good-time” collaboration hatched by award winning songwriters Carolann Solebello,Karyn Oliver, and The YaYas (Catherine Miles and Jay Mafale). It’s like getting three bands for the price of one when these friends share the stage: a dynamic, cohesive cocktail of delicious harmonies, infectious rhythm, and spontaneous hilarity. Individually, the four are nationally touring performers that have charted at the top of Folk and Americana radio and appeared on stage at some of the most respected festivals. Collectively, they are an incorrigible bunch of musical co-conspirators bent on giving their audience an unforgettable show.

It is best to buy your ticket far in advance, they sell out often. The tickets are general seating for $20 and can be purchased online here.

Let's meet 20 minutes early so that we can find seats together.
results.name: No Fuss and Feathers at the Circle of Friends Coffeehouse in Franklin

results.description:
Let's dance salsa!

Saturday Night Salsa is Boston's biggest salsa dance party on Saturday featuring salsa dancing and lessons with Salsa y Control, an amazing venue filled with 300+ welcoming salsa dancers, an inexpensive parking garage next door, and public transport on Mass Ave. (Red Line, Buses 1, 64 etc.) one block away!

9:00-10:00 pm:  Beginner & Intermediate. Salsa Lessons
10:00-2 am: Dance Party * No Partner Required

Lets meet at 9 pm (facing the stage) at the right side of the stage.

There are some tables alongside the wall. These tables are typically first come, first serve, so if we all arrive at the same time and early, we can occupy these tables.

I will make some Meetup signs and try to post them at these tables.  These tables can serve as our meeting point through out the night.  Last time I asked for permission and  management informed me that posting signs was not allowed.  I may not ask for permission this time and discretely post a night flat on the table.  

I also have some neon/glow-in-the-dark bracelets and necklaces that I plan to wear and pass out to members of the group so we can recognize each other more easily.

Please only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and plan to meet members of the group.  If you reserve "YES" and have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.  This is an actual event, not an advertisement. 

Please be on time! If you arrive late, I can not guarantee that you will be able to recognize members of the group from the crowds.

This should be a super fun event and a super friendly event for salsa beginners and the advanced dancers.


I am really looking forward to enjoying this event as part of the group.

Wear comfortable shoes!

Joana

******************************************************************************************************************************

Event Details

Beginners Very Welcome

No partner required

$12 - Admission includes lesson and party

Dress Code: Smart Casual to Elegant (No ball caps, no work boots, etc.)

Beer, Wine, Mixed Drinks, etc. available at Bar

Music format: 65% salsa, 25% bachata, 10% merengue/cha cha

***********************************
Driving Directions: Take Storrow or Memorial Drive to River St. (where the two gas stations are), then a right on Mass Ave, a right on Pearl St (where FootLocker and Putnam Furniture is), and your first right on Green St.

Parking: There is a large, inexpensive ($1.50/hr)parking garage right next door - you can't miss it!

Walking Directions (from Red Line's Central Stop): From Mass Ave take a left on Prospect St then a left on Green St. It is a one minute walk.

Please note that the Night Salsa parties are 21+.

* Don't forget your ID!

http://www.havanaclubsalsa.com

results.description:
Event Organizer: Michael Blair @ (978)[masked]

01/18 - This event listing has been updated to reflect the finalized plans. I will be adding people who indicated that the Kinsmans were their choice. Group size is limited to 10 so if you can't make it please change your RSVP to NO so that others can join.

=====

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all of the questions that are part of the process. Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event.

Answers DO NOT carry over from one event to another so you must answer them for EACH EVENT. Also, questions might not show up if you RSVP from a phone or tablet so if you don't see them you will need to use a computer.

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself and others at risk. Consider this before you RSVP.

=== What We're Doing ===

The plan is to hike to two of the 4,000 footers in New Hampshire - North and South Kinsman. We will use Mount Kinsman Trail and Kinsman Ridge Trail to cross over North Kinsman and reach South Kinsman. From there we will retrace our steps to get back to the trailhead.

If you are interested in participating in this event sign up for the waiting list. I will add people that (1) answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process and (2) have done similar hikes within the past three months.


RSVPs close 24 hours before the event.

The maximum group size for this trip will be 10 people. 

Guests aren't permitted.

Dogs are only permitted with prior approval of the event organizer.

=== Trip Summary ===

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you. 

On this moderate pace (~2.0 MPH) trip we will hike about 9.8 miles and climb about 3,900 feet. It should take an average hiker about 7 hours to complete (this duration does not include time for breaks). This event is considered INTERMEDIATE because of the pace, distance, and elevation gain.

Use this link for more information about where we are going and how we will get there:

• http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/22-South-Kinsman-4358--28-North-Kinsman-4293

Dangerous weather conditions will cancel this event - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants. 

Use this link for the current weather forecast:

• http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=44.12867891700046&lon=-71.73646581999964#.Vp1AJDawlrU

=== What to Bring === 

Don't wear ANY cotton - this includes your socks and underwear. You will need winter hiking boots - if you wear them in the summer they aren't designed for winter use (e.g. insulation). You will need mountaineering snow shoes. Not all snowshoes are the same - some are designed for steep terrain with potentially deep snow while others aren't. These are the acceptable brands and models:

• Tubbs Flex ALP, Flex VRT, Flex TRK, or Mountaineers.

• MSR Lightening, Revo, or Evo. 

• TSL Symbioz Elite or Expert. 

• Atlas Aspect, Endeavor, or Series 10/11/12.

You will also need traction - while you can bring mountaineering crampons if you want I think all you will need is either Kahtoola Microspikes or Hillsound Trail Crampons. DO NOT BRING IMITATION SPIKES OR ANY FORM OF YAK TRAX.

Use this link for a list of items needed for a winter day hike: 

• </a><a href="http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf">http://files.meetup.com/492954/Winter_Day_Hike_List_ADK.pdf

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

=== Directions ===

We will meet at the Mount Kinsman Trailhead which is located on the east side of Route 116 near Franconia, NH. According to Google Maps this spot is about 146 miles from Boston and it should take about 2 hours 21 minutes to drive there.

Use this link to customize the driving directions:

• https://goo.gl/maps/XUCka3GXhf12

</a>

While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride.

=== Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer ===

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the <a href="http://www.hikesafe.com/">Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

Meet to paint the model for a five week pose- Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $75, non-members for $90.    Three hours each Sunday morning, 9:30-12:30.  You can come individual days by paying $15 (members) or $25 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at


http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html 

PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $75 or $90 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.

results.description:
Starting just over the line in N. Andover we will go through Harold Parker State Forest, Skug & Hammond Reservations, Ward Reservation, Phillips Academy & Purdon Reservation  Distance  10.6 mi. Time Approx. 4-5+ hrs

This Hike will require a car spot! We will meet at the end of hike and carpool to the beginning!

Please don't RSVP "Yes" unless you really intend to come. I am committed to being there for you. If you are not equally committed to being there then please don't sign up. 

Please note this is not a beginners’ hike. It is for intermediate level hikers and beginning hikers who keep in fit condition doing other things. You should be in good enough physical condition to keep up and stay with the group going at a moderate pace. Please do not show up for an event unexpected or unprepared.Bring water, hiking boots (not sneakers), bug spray and lunch/snacks. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers.

This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy rain or extreme temperature cancels.

No dogs and no guests are allowed on hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event. 

Please remember that I am a volunteer, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen. If you are expecting Daniel Boone as your leader, you’re barking up the wrong tree. If you need everything to run perfectly, this hike is not for you.

 By signing up and/or attending this hike you agree to the Liability Waiver Below:
Remember: I am a volunteer. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reason

results.description:
Today is Friday, January 29. We are on for Sunday!

This ski event is sponsored by the AMC Boston Chapter Ski Committee. No advance signup is required, but you will be asked to sign a waiver which can be viewed at:

http://www.outdoors.org/pdf/upload/volrelease.PDF

For information on more trips and workshops please see the ski committees website at:

http://amcboston.org/ski/index.html

The AMC listing is pasted below and can be viewed on the club’s On-Line Trip Listing System, search for the specific trip at:

http://activities.outdoors.org/search/index.cfm/action/main/

Ski Committee show and go Sunday XC ski series. Meet at noted touring center at 10 am for 5-6 hours of moderate paced, led machine cut track kick and glide skiing. Novice to advanced skiers welcome, we will ski a few hours, return to the lodge for lunch, then ski a few hours in the afternoon. Group will likely break into a faster and more moderate paced group; extremely fast (and skaters) or slower skiers are welcome to self-guide. These are show and go trips on machine groomed and patrolled nordic centers, no need to pre-register. Participants should self-pay for the center trail fee. We recommend beginners take a group lesson before attending one of these trips. All trips ski off at 10 am sharp, arrive in time to get your skis waxed and gear together; look for leaders at trail head near lodge. Trips may go in marginal conditions, but lack of snow and/or rain will likely cancel the trip. Consult leader with questions.

More Information at Nordic Center websites, click on the one for the selected trip:

http://windblownxc.com

http://www.waterville.com/ski-ride/nordic-center.html

http://www.skiboston.com/skitrack/skitrack.php

http://www.greatbrookski.comhttp://

www.gunstock.com/winter/nordic/

results.description:
Greater Boston Oasis meets every week for engaging speakers, live musicians, and the opportunity to connect with the community. Details of the speakers, musical guests, etc. will be posted in the individual meetups as they are confirmed.

Doors for the event open at 10:00 AM for coffee and conversation, with the program starting at 10:30. We hope to see you there!


=========================================


"Reality is known through reason", the Oasis core value says, and in order to apply reason we need to look at evidence. We need to see the data. But how can you spot when what you're shown isn't telling the real story? So that we might draw accurate conclusions, we will delve into some of the more common ways that the presentation of data is manipulated and how the end result can imply false conclusions.

=========================================

Oasis meets in the Teen Center at the YMCA. To find the room, enter through the lower entrance (on Dartmouth Street, by the swimming pool), and follow Oasis signs from the front lobby to the Teen Center on the second floor. (Note: the stairwell to the Teen Center is NOT the stairwell in the front lobby. That is Stairwell A. The Teen Center is located at Stairwell B, next to the Yoga Studio. Oasis volunteers will be available to help provide assistance, and signage will be posted.

=========================================

Greater Boston Oasis is a secular community dedicated to providing for the human need for social and intellectual community, for those people who may not want or be able to have those needs met in a church or other faith-based community. 


Our Core Values are:

People are more important than beliefs

Reality is known through reason

Meaning comes from making a difference

Human hands solve human problems

Be accepting, and be accepted


Atheist or agnostic, freethinker or skeptic, deist or theist, all those with whom those values resonate are welcome to celebrate the human experience.
results.how_to_find_us: Follow signs from the entrance to the Teen Center room. Use the Dartmouth Street entrance, and head to Stairwell B. Teen Center is on the 2nd floor.
results.name: Sunday Gathering: J. Michael Spencer - Lies, Damned Lies, and Statistics

results.description:
We will be working through Meyer text on the Dussack.  We will also look at how these techniques apply to  One-handed or arming sword.

We are going to interpret Joachim Meyer’s Dussak.  The translation we will use is in

The Art of Combat: A German Martial Arts Treatise of 1570 (Hardcover)

http://www.amazon.com/gp/offer-listing/1848327781/ref=sr_1_5_twi_2_har_olp?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1434813702&sr=1-5&keywords=meyer

with additional material from Meyer’s 1560 work

https://sites.google.com/site/jochimmeyer1560/home/Meyer_1560_english_Maurer_2012.pdf?attredirects=0&d=1

From Jakob Sutor’s “New Illustrated Fechtbuch” of 1612

Here's a link to Weston Ski Track.
http://www.skiboston.com/skitrack/skitrack.php

This ski event is sponsored by the AMC Boston Chapter Ski Committee. No advance signup is required, but you will be asked to sign a waiver which can be viewed at:
http://www.outdoors.org/pdf/upload/volrelease.PDF

For information on more trips and workshops please see the ski committees website at:
http://amcboston.org/ski/index.html

The AMC listing is pasted below and can be viewed on the club’s On-Line Trip Listing System, search for the specific trip at:
http://activities.outdoors.org/search/index.cfm/action/main/

Ski Committee show and go Sunday XC ski series. Meet at noted touring center at 10 am for 5-6 hours of moderate paced, led machine cut track kick and glide skiing. Novice to advanced skiers welcome, we will ski a few hours, return to the lodge for lunch, then ski a few hours in the afternoon. Group will likely break into a faster and more moderate paced group; extremely fast (and skaters) or slower skiers are welcome to self-guide. These are show and go trips on machine groomed and patrolled nordic centers, no need to pre-register. Participants should self-pay for the center trail fee. We recommend beginners take a group lesson before attending one of these trips. All trips ski off at 10 am sharp, arrive in time to get your skis waxed and gear together; look for leaders at trail head near lodge. Trips may go in marginal conditions, but lack of snow and/or rain will likely cancel the trip. Consult leader with questions.

Now part of the Massachusetts Forests and Parks system, Walden Pond State Reservation includes 462 acres of protected open space so that visitors from near and far may come to experience the pond that inspired Thoreau. In summer the Reservation is a popular swimming destination. In the spring and fall, many people hike the trails that ring the pond and visit the replica of Thoreau's one-room cabin.

results.description:
BEGINNER TANGO: Absolute Beginning

Beginner Tango course is meant for people who either never ever danced Argentine Tango, took few classes long time ago or took few lessons quite recently but are not sure what they know or if they are ready for next level.

You will learn basics necessary to progress further. The material is presented in very organized manner allowing smooth progress from class to class. 

Please note that even if you dance other dances like salsa, swing, zouk or any of Ballroom or American Style dances, even if for years you took ballet, jazz, hip hop or any other of solo dances, you need to take the Beginner level class. The axis, the basis for the dance, musicality and partnership is completely different. Taking those 4 classes might be the life changing experience for you. It is obvious that having dance background helps, but it shall also give you enough experience to know that the basic classes are THE MOST IMPORTANT ONES, as they create a base for all your learning experience. What you don’t know will always and always chase you.

 It’s good to take this course to put all your information in order. You gain the necessary vocabulary and learn all the basic movements to be able to easily follow the explanations in higher level courses. Please respect our commitment to excellence. And make it your own.

No partner necessary. Join at any time – though we do recommend starting at the beginning of the cycle (see: http://www.ultimatetango.com/boston-classes.html for dates). You can take this course as many times as you find necessary for you.

The full course consists of 8 90-minutes classes plus exam/graduation even (about 4 hrs).


SIGN UP NOW: https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/ws?studioid=208847&stype=-7&sTG=25&sView=week
results.how_to_find_us: Follow your intuition and detective instincts. Still cannot find it? Email us at: ultimatetango@gmail.com

results.description:
Monthly conversation group for teens and adults from noon to 1:45pm. Open to the public. Located near any bus line to Watertown Square.

Eating a whole-food, plant-based diet is good for your health and weight management. It’s important for our threatened environment and is both conscionable and economical. 

This group is for those who are already eating a plant-based diet and those who just want to ease into eating more plant-based meals. 

We share ideas, stories, resources, concerns and support. Optional lunch to follow at the newly opened Wild Rice Vegan Cafe in Watertown. 

Come along even if you just want to get a cup of tea and continue to socialize. 

They don't have a website yet but you can see their menu at: https://www.facebook.com/wildricevegancafe/menu

Annie Bernhard passes along her veganism-for-the-win article of the day, about how a high-fiber diet supports, and can to some extent restore, the microbial communities in our guts.
On the other hand, a high-meat diet decimates them.
She offers as one of her favorite lines:
"If you eat minimally processed plants, which humans have for millions of years, you cannot avoid fiber."

The Trustees and Ward Reservation Property Committee, in partnership with the Andover Trails Committee and Friends of North Andover Trails, will host a Winter Fun Day. Short to medium length guided hikes to different destinations on the reservation will leave periodically throughout the afternoon. Cross-country skiing, snowshoeing, sledding, refreshments, and a warming fire will be available throughout the afternoon. A great chance to try out those cross-country skis, snowshoes, or sleds you got for the holidays!

Schedule:

- 12:30PM: Guided hike to Boston Hill, 3 miles, 1.5 hours.

- 1PM: Guided hike to the Judy Trail, 3 mile, 1.5 hours.

- Periodic guided hikes around Holt Hill and the bog, 1 mile, .5 hour.

Park at the reservation entrance on Prospect Road, east of Route 125, in Andover. Follow signs to the activities. The event will take place with or without snow on the ground.
